Please enter equation with variable x
Example 2x + 1 or 2x^2 + x - 2 History Font Theme Solve tangent What new?

Default calculator mode Radian

To calculate sin, cos, tan … the in degree, type sin (30 °), cos (90 °), …

 

For expressions that contain parameters, enter an * (multiplication) between parameters and variables. Example:

$$ 2x ^ 2 + mx + 2 = 0 $$ Enter  2x ^ 2 + m * x + 2 = 0

$$\\ frac {1} { 2ax + b}$$ Enter 1  / (2a * x + b)

 

LEARN SOME OPERATORS SUPPORT

+ (Plus sign)

Drain

- (Minus sign)

Minus

* (Multiply sign)

Multiply

/

Divide

% (Percent sign)

Percent

^

Exponentiation

!

Factorial

 

Constants (Keyboard expr)

Pi

pi

HEY

e

i

Imaginary unit

Infinity

Infinity

 

SIGHT AND MATHEMATICS CONTENT IS SUPPORTED

Sqrt (x) or √ (x)

Returns the positive square root of x

Cbrt (x)

Cube root of x

Abs (x)

Returns the absolute value of a number

sin (x)

Returns the sine of angle x gave

cos (x)

Returns the cosine of the angle x

tan (x)

Returns the tangent of the angle x

Asin (x) or Arcsin (x)

Returns the inverse cosine of a number

Acos (x) or Arccos(x)

Returns the arccosine of a number

Atan (x) or Arctan (x)

The arctangent function.

sinh (x)

Sinh function

cosh (x)

Cosh function

tanh (x)

Tanh function

C(n, k)

Combinations

P(n, k)

Permutation

asinh (x) or arcsinh (x)

The hyperbolic arcsine function.

acosh (x) or arccosh (x)

The hyperbolic arccosine function.

atanh (x) or arctanh (x)

The hyperbolic arctangent function.

ln(x)

Logarithm base e

log(x)

Returns the natural logarithm of x..

Log(a, b)

Logarithm base a of b

Exp(x)

Returns the ceiling value of x.

Celi (x)

Rounds a number away from 0

Floor (x)

Returns the floor value of x.

Max (a, b)

Returns the largest value in two numbers a and b

Min (a, b)

Returns the smallest value in two numbers a and b

Rnd (a)

Random function

GDC(a, b)

The least common multiple of a and b

LCM(a, b)

Greatest common divisor of a and b

Sign(x)

Gives -1, 0 or 1 depending on whether x is negative, zero or positive.

Hand Geometric Expands out trigonometric expressions. Rewrites products and powers of trigonometric functions in terms of trigonometric functions with combined arguments. Converts trigonometric functions to exponential. Trigonometry Expand Trigonometry Reduce Trigonometry to Exponent Trigonometry KaTeX is faster than MathJax on mobile environment, but MathJax supports more features and is much more beautiful.
